answers.answer: Hi there!Avoiding smoking, adequate control of diabetes and calcium supplementation are the minimum measures one should take aside regular follow up to check for healing progress.Hope this helps.Take care!

question: A patient with a fresh fracture of the distal radius has been treated with Open Reduction/Internal Fixation (ORIF).  The patient is expected to heal, but there are some risk factors.  The patient is a diabetic smoker with osteoporosis.  What extra treatments could be used to help increase the odds that this patient will heal?
